conbody.p: Sometimes users need more control over how objects are dumped to disk. DOOD provide a general mechanism called a proxy, which provides both a disk representation of an object and a reconstruction policy. The basic idea is that during the dumping process each memory object is given a chance to provide a disk object (a proxy) to be used for dumping and then upon loading, a loaded disk object is given a chance to map back to its original memory object. Proxies can be used for mapping objects back to unique runtime objects, for compressing objects, for looking up objects in external databases, etc.
